‚Ä¢ Experience across NLP, sentiment analysis, network/graph analysis, time series analysis, reinforcement learning, computer vision with a deep specialization in one area
‚Ä¢ Solid statistical foundation and inspired creative mathematical understanding of real world problems
‚Ä¢ Experience building production-level machine learning systems
‚Ä¢ Knowledge of technologies such as Tensorflow, Keras, Hadoop, Postgres, AWS, Docker

What You‚Äôll Love At FINESSE
‚Ä¢ Being at the forefront of and working towards creating a culture-defining new product
‚Ä¢ A close-knit, extremely passionate & world class team excited about changing the face of fashion
‚Ä¢ A diverse team and culture that values inclusivity and individuality as highest priority
‚Ä¢ Company sponsored happy hours and outings
‚Ä¢ Comprehensive benefits: Medical, dental and vision insurance; 401k
‚Ä¢ Paid maternity and paternity leave
‚Ä¢ Sponsored weekly team lunches
‚Ä¢ Unlimited PTO

Our Culture

FINESSE has a dreamer & doer culture. We envision the next age of fashion & consumer and then get to work to implement it, always thinking creatively, innovatively and collaboratively to create real change. We are energetic, highly creative and hungry for change that is both revolutionizing as well as ethical

At Scandit, we develop real-time computer vision solutions for smartphones, wearables and robots that combine modern machine learning approaches with computer vision. Who We Are

Scandit enables enterprises and consumers to change the way they interact with everyday objects and augment the physical world with real-time data captured by scanning barcodes and recognizing text, objects, and other visual identifiers using smartphones, tablets, wearables, drones and robots.

Scandit‚Äôs mobile data capture platform is built on proprietary computer vision, augmented reality, and machine learning technologies. Companies in industries such as retail, transportation & logistics, manufacturing, and healthcare can use Scandit‚Äôs technology to create and power mobile apps for crucial enterprise workflows like mobile point of sale, mobile shopping, self-checkout, inventory management, and proof of delivery.

Scandit was founded by a group of researchers from ETH Zurich and MIT. The company is headquartered in Zurich and is also represented in Boston, London, Warsaw, Tokyo and Tampere. Job-Title: Machine Learning and C++ Engineer for Game Technology
Description:
Why PlayStation?

PlayStation isn‚Äôt just the Best Place to Play ‚Äî it‚Äôs also the Best Place to Work. Today, we‚Äôre recognized as a global leader in entertainment producing The PlayStation family of products and services including PlayStation¬Æ5, PlayStation¬Æ4, PlayStation¬ÆVR, PlayStation¬ÆPlus, acclaimed PlayStation software titles from PlayStation Studios, and more.

PlayStation also strives to create an inclusive environment that empowers employees and embraces diversity. We welcome and encourage everyone who has a passion and curiosity for innovation, technology, and play to explore our open positions and join our growing global team.

The PlayStation brand falls under Sony Interactive Entertainment, a wholly-owned subsidiary of Sony Corporation.

Machine Learning and C++ Engineer for Game Technology

We are looking for a machine learning engineer with a solid understanding of low-level systems programming. If you are as comfortable in the memory view of your debugger as you are with... training networks to solve problems, we would love you hear from you.

This role could suit an experienced embedded/games industry programmer with a passion for Machine Learning, or an accomplished Machine Learning/Vision programmer with a good understanding of computer architecture and performance.

The Team

The Advanced Technology Group (ATG) is part of PlayStation Studios, and contributes to some of the most recognisable and ambitious console games and franchises. In addition to its original mission of developing ground-breaking technology for our games, which this role falls under, the group is also a key contributor to platform development, with among other things responsibility for a large part of the GPU software stack all PS5 games are built with.

You will be part of a small creative team of ATG programmers tackling problems centred around computer vision and machine learning. Examples of some projects include the runtime tracking of PlayStation VR2 Sense controllers and a novel facial performance capture system used to produce assets for AAA games.

The Role

You are expected to develop innovative algorithms to solve novel problems, make technology choices, prototype solutions and bring them to production. Some of these systems are expected to run on millions of PlayStations in people‚Äôs homes, making high run-time performance crucial. You should stay up to date with the competition and the industry‚Äôs latest advances and academic developments. The role also involves close collaboration with our other teams in Europe, the U.S and Japan, as well as technical communication of the ideas and solutions developed.

The Essential Requirements
‚Ä¢ Strong C++ programming and debugging skills supported by a fundamental understanding of computer architectures and performance.
‚Ä¢ Experience with modern Machine Learning (PyTorch/TensorFlow): You will be expected to make decisions about data and architectures, to implement pipelines for training and validation and to develop and deploy models in production.
‚Ä¢ Understanding of 3D maths/geometry: Including multiple-view geometry and 3D mesh representations.

Nice-to-have
‚Ä¢ Experience with Graphics and/or Game Engines
‚Ä¢ Experience with Computer Vision

Benefits

‚Ä¢ Private Medical Insurance
‚Ä¢ Dental Scheme
‚Ä¢ 25 days holiday per year
‚Ä¢ On Site Gym
‚Ä¢ Subsidised Caf√©

Come create the technology that helps the world act together

Nokia is committed to innovation and technology leadership across mobile, fixed and cloud networks. Your career here will have a positive impact on people‚Äôs lives and will help us build the capabilities needed for a more productive, sustainable, and inclusive world.

We challenge ourselves to create an inclusive way of working where we are open to new ideas, empowered to take risks and fearless to bring our authentic selves to work.

The team you'll be part of Nokia Bell Labs is the world-renowned research arm of Nokia, having invented many of the foundational technologies that underpin information and communications networks and all digital devices and systems. This research has produced nine Nobel Prizes, five Turing Awards and numerous other awards.

The AI Research Lab at Bell Labs Solutions Research invites applications for a senior research scientist position in machine learning. The Lab has a long tradition of... excellence in research and currently consists of 80 staff members with expertise in algorithmic and computing sciences, stochastic networks, information theory and machine learning.‚ÄØ Candidates will have a strong and proven background in computing sciences, such as deep learning and reinforcement learning methods, and a natural interest in innovatively applying fundamental tools and methods in focused problem areas.

The successful applicant will conduct high quality research in reinforcement learning and its applications including communications in radio etworks, industrial automation, robotics, and human sensing. What you will learn and contribute toAre you passionate about solving problems?

As part of our team, you will:

Develop new reinforcement learning and other related methods and models. Follow reinforcement learning and related fields to be familiar with, and to improve over, current state of the art methods. Implement reinforcement learning methods in frameworks of your choice (for example, PyTorch/JAX/Tensor Flow) and train them on GPU clusters on large amounts of data. Present research findings through papers and oral presentations both within the organization and to the external research community.

Produce quantifiable demonstrations of your research. Actively participate in new and challenging application areas that arise in the analysis and optimization of communications and networking systems and participate in team efforts. Apply machine learning methods to challenging applications that can have a positive impact on the world. Your skills and experience

Candidates must either hold a PhD in machine learning, data or computer sciences, computational and mathematics (e.g. statistical methods), or related fields, or finalizing their PhD studies in near future. Previous experience in reinforcement learning, deep learning, large-scale machine learning, proof-of-concept systems design and implementation considered as an advantage. A proven track record in a related field is desirable. The candidate would be working in a team consisting of machine learning scientist and engineers with expertise in deep learning, reinforcement learning and differential privacy.

For further information regarding this position contact
mikko.honkala@nokia-bell-labs.comWhen applying for the position through the website, please note that we mainly consider your resume, preferably in PDF format. Other fields may be filled briefly.

What we offer

Nokia offers flexible and hybrid working schemes, continuous learning opportunities, well-being programs to support you mentally and physically, opportunities to join and get supported by employee resource groups, mentoring programs and highly diverse teams with an inclusive culture where people thrive and are empowered.

Nokia Bell Labs offers unique mix of academic work joint with real-life use cases in an industrial setting.

Nokia is committed to inclusion and is an equal opportunity employer

One of the World‚Äôs Most Ethical Companies by Ethisphere Gender-Equality Index by Bloomberg Workplace Pride Global Benchmark

Job-Title: (Remote) Senior Backend & Machine Learning Engineer - Super App
Description:
About The Job

As a Backend Engineer on the team, you‚Äôll be building out the product, helping design and implement new features, and helping drive the product direction to make sure we solve the right user problems, and find innovative ways to delight our customers. You‚Äôll collaborate with an integrated team of talented engineers, designers, pms and data scientists to break down complex problems, experiment quickly, and build things at internet scale.

Our team is focused on accelerating Hopper‚Äôs user growth, which until now has been primarily through high-volume paid advertising. Now, we‚Äôre looking to build new products in our app that will help us activate, retain and acquire new users at scale. We‚Äôll be testing a wide range of new ideas, from redesigning the onboarding, to building gamification, flash sales, team buying, and other experimental features. Overall, our goal is to pair Hopper‚Äôs world-class travel marketplace with the growth and retention mechanisms inspired by mobile... games, super-apps, and category-leading retailers.

Responsibilities

‚Ä¢ Quickly prototype new ideas and run experiments to identify features that users love
‚Ä¢ Help evolve our mobile architecture to consistently improve development efficiencyInfluence the technical direction for the team and the strategic direction of the product

Qualifications

‚Ä¢ Experience with Machine Learning (ML) and core ML serving infrastructure
‚Ä¢ Solid understanding of basic web backend concepts - databases, routes, data models, middleware, auth, etc.

Benefits

‚Ä¢ Small, dynamic teams = massive impact

More About Hopper

At Hopper, we are on a mission to become the world‚Äôs best ‚Äî and most fun ‚Äî place to book travel. By leveraging massive amounts of data, advanced machine learning algorithms, Hopper combines its world-class travel agency offering with proprietary fintech products to help customers spend less and travel better. Ranked the third largest online travel agency in North America, the app has been downloaded nearly 80 million times and continues to gain market share globally.

Here are just a few stats that demonstrate the company‚Äôs recent growth:
‚Ä¢ Hopper sold around $4 billion in travel and travel fintech in 2022, up nearly 3X over 2021. In 2022, Hopper increased its revenue 2.5X year-over year.
‚Ä¢ The company‚Äôs bespoke fintech products, such as Flight Disruption Guarantee and Price Freeze, now represent 30-40% of Hopper‚Äôs total app revenue.
‚Ä¢ Given the success of its fintech products, Hopper launched a B2B initiative called Hopper Cloud in late 2021. Through this partnership program, any travel provider (airlines, hotels, banks, travel agencies, etc.) can integrate and seamlessly distribute Hopper‚Äôs fintech or travel inventory. As its first Hopper Cloud partnership,
‚Ä¢ Hopper partnered with Capital One to co-develop Capital One Travel, a new travel portal designed specifically for cardholders.
‚Ä¢ Recognized as one of the world‚Äôs most innovative companies by Fast Company four years in a row, Hopper has been downloaded over 80 million times and continues to have millions of new installs each month.
‚Ä¢ Hopper has raised over $700 million USD of private capital and is backed by some of the largest institutional investors and banks in the world. Hopper is primed to continue its acceleration as the world‚Äôs fastest-growing mobile-first travel marketplace.

Come take off with us

.

Our platform uses advanced machine learning to perform prospecting on autopilot, and can identify the right customer for the right company t time.

We have incredible backers in Sequoia Capital and Entrepreneur First who are partnering with us on our ambitious mission.

Having been chosen to the inaugural Sequoia Arc program in Europe from amongst 3000+ startups just further validates our belief that we are on to something truly remarkable.

We are building a team of superstars to undertake this legendary journey with us. . The role

We‚Äôre looking for a Machine Learning Engineer who wants to build something with ML that has real-world impact. Your work on our recommendation and personalisation systems will be crucial to how we fulfil our mission of automating prospecting and central to how we... grow as a company.

If you enjoy hacking together ML projects but now want to see them have tangible impact with real customers then this is the role for you. .

You will Design and build key Machine Learning models from scratch, owning the design and implementation of critical features of Telescope's infrastructure.

Work closely with technical leadership in defining the engineering and product roadmap

Collaborate with colleagues in product, design and engineering to bring value to customers . You may be a fit for this role if youHave an MSc or PhD in Machine Learning or a related discipline, or 2+ years experience working as a Machine Learning engineer.

Have strong knowledge and experience of Python.

Are experienced in applied Machine Learning using Pytorch or similar ML frameworks, Hugging Face and Spacy to solve problems in recommendations and NLP.

Are results-oriented and not fond of outdated or unnecessary processes

Take pride in creating technologies that solve real world problems

Have no respect for the status quo and a burning desire to leave a dent in the universe

Thrive in a fast paced, collaborative startup environment but also‚Ä¶Want to work in a team that is kind and genuinely cares about each other

You're encouraged to apply even if your experience doesn't precisely match the job description.

- At Telescope, we're always looking for extremely talented individuals. If you are crazy enough to think you can bring about a revolutionary change that benefits humankind, and want to do it by working intelligently, in a novel and creative way, with passion, and with integrity, we want to hear from you. Your talents and drive will stand out ‚Äì and set you apart ‚Äì especially if your career has taken some extraordinary twists and turns

Do you want to make BIG WAVES or tiny ripples?

Yeah, we‚Äôre big waves people too.

Duco‚Äôs Machine Learning Team is in a rare and privileged position: We have massive business use cases to push to prod.

Duco focuses on mission-critical data processes with millions of rows processed daily, which means a lot of work for Machine Learning!

Our clear interest is to have someone that has a strong bias towards shipping to prod first and then iterate, NOT chasing the new shiniest Deep Learning model without caring about its implementation.

What you‚Äôll be doing (everything will happen in AWS, Sagemaker particularly):
‚Ä¢ Create Data Ingestion Pipelines
‚Ä¢ Do Exploratory Data Analysis
‚Ä¢ Do Feature Engineering and train the models
‚Ä¢ Write quality tests

An extensive reward package:
‚Ä¢ A competitive salary, reviewed... annually
‚Ä¢ Annual success sharing bonus scheme based on Duco hitting key milestones, annually published and tracked so everyone can see how we‚Äôre doing
‚Ä¢ Unlimited holiday, because we trust people to manage their own time off
‚Ä¢ 4 Volunteering days off that can be used flexibly based on the employee‚Äôs choice of initiative
‚Ä¢ Flexible working options, including location and hours. We all have to juggle home and work stuff sometimes!
‚Ä¢ Enhanced family leave provisions, e.g. generous maternity and paternity leave
‚Ä¢ A range of personal learning and development opportunities
‚Ä¢ Spot rewards, so we can say thanks when you do a really great bit of work
‚Ä¢ Healthcare and eyecare schemes
‚Ä¢ Pension scheme with 5% employer contributions
‚Ä¢ Tax-efficient cycle to work and tech purchase schemes
‚Ä¢ Employee Assistance Programme, for extra support outside of work
‚Ä¢ Annual home working allowance to help make your personal space comfortable

Job-Title: Research Fellow in Machine Learning Accelerated Weather and Climate Modelling
Description:
Post Title: Research Fellow in Machine Learning Accelerated Weather and Climate Modelling

SBU/Department: School of Physics, Engineering and Computer Science

FTE: 1 FTE (working 37 hours per week)

Duration of Contract: 36 Month Fixed Term Contract

Salary: UH7 ¬£35,333 - ¬£42,155 per annum depending on skills and experience

Location: College Lane Campus, Hatfield

Main duties and responsibilities

The Research Fellow will help lead a project combining weather and climate modelling with machine learning to develop new techniques to efficiently predict key meteorological parameters at high spatial and temporal resolution. The Fellow will be responsible for running, maintaining and updating relevant software and codes on the University‚Äôs Unix/Linux-based high-performance cluster.

The successful candidate will be required to problem-solve day-to-day issues related to the research project and contribute to the development of processes-based approaches including the use of large datasets... of model predictions and observations. They must also be able to work well in a team and be prepared to communicate key findings with team-members and stakeholders.

In addition, the Research Fellow will also assist in other activities and projects when required. For example, the preparation of funding proposals and maintenance of the high-performance computing cluster and relevant software.

Skill And Experience Required

You will have proven experience working in a research environment and experience of presenting research findings such as contributions to conferences and symposia at a local and national level.

You must have experience in one or more of the following areas:

(i) Demonstrable experience of the development and use of advanced high resolution regional scale weather and/or climate models, specifically using WRF.

(ii) Experience of setting up, running and validating Large Eddy Simulations with WRF.

(iii) Understanding of the theory of multiple scale dynamical and climate interactions and process analysis through the combined use of regional and global models.

(iv) Experience in the use of computational programming techniques for atmospheric physics applications e.g. use of languages such as Fortran and Python on Unix platforms, data analysis/visualisation techniques and the ability to maintain codes

(v) Experience in meteorological and climate measurements

(vi) Other experience such as the use of global climate models will also be relevant

(vii) Experience using machine learning techniques, ideally neural networks and their applications

The ability to plan and manage your own activities effectively is essential. You will have good oral and written communication skills in both spoken and written English. Excellent interpersonal and presentation skills are essential.

Qualifications Required

You will hold an Undergraduate Honours Degree at a minimum 2:2 (or equivalent) in a relevant discipline (e.g. Physics, Chemistry, Mathematics, Meteorology, Computer Science, Engineering) and a PhD (or equivalent) or close to completion (no more than 3 months prior to viva) in a relevant subject related to meteorological and/or climate modelling and observation with strong computer programming elements based on Unix based cluster systems.

Please view the job description and person specification and the Annex providing further details for a full list of the duties and essential criteria. Please attach a personal statement showing clearly how your skills and experience match the Person Specification.

Contact Details/Informal Enquiries: James Geach, j.geach@herts.ac.uk

Closing Date: 22 February 2023

Interview Date: TBC

Reference Number: 048015

Date advert placed: 25 January 2023

Our vision is to transform lives: UH is committed to Equality, Diversity and Inclusion and building a diverse community. We welcome applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of their protected characteristics, and recognise there are different ways applicants may achieve the criteria in this document. We offer a range of employee benefits including generous annual leave, flexible location opportunities within the UK, discounted Sports Village memberships and free Active Staff sessions, personal and professional development and family-friendly policies. #GoHerts

Apply online at https://www.jobs.herts.ac.uk/go/048015

Job-Title: Team Lead, Machine Learning for Biological Discovery (Global)
Description: Our Mission To restore cell health and resilience through cellular rejuvenation programming to reverse disease, injury, and the disabilities that can occur throughout life. Ability to communicate technical concepts to people less familiar with the field. A good influencer, able to drive change while bringing others along; Team player - enjoys working on larger efforts with others and puts the success of their team above their own; Committed to fostering an inclusive and diverse workforce that enables all participants to contribute to their full potential in pursuit of organizational objectives; Brings a can-do attitude that approaches problems and opportunities with curiosity and creativity; Growth mindset - desire to constantly expand your skill set and knowledge. Keen to learn more about biology, computational science, and medicine; Attentive to detail with excellent time management, multi-tasking, and prioritization skills; Deep analytical thinker and problem solver; Additional attributes and experience include: Experience in a large company / industry setting; Experience in cell health and rejuvenation related research area; Experience in computational approaches to drug discovery; Experience with software development and open source software; Experience with patent and IP capture. Leadership Qualities and Behaviors Altos values: humility, hyper-collaboration, curiosity, generosity and transparency Results oriented Self-Aware Excellent Teamwork and Collaboration skills Excellent Listening skills Strategic Agility Dealing with Ambiguity Responsibilities Working across all Altos sites (Bay Area, Cambridge, San Diego), expand and lead a global team that applies machine learning to biological discovery and translation on projects pertaining to Altos‚Äô mission; Partner with world-class biologists across all Altos sites to help design studies on cell health and rejuvenation that tap into the potential of machine learning and help generate biological insights; Partner with other computational scientists and leaders at Altos to develop the vision and strategy for machine learning at Altos; Develop and support a learning culture with the goal of forging a team that can draw on machine learning and AI to produce deep biological insights; Develop new statistical and machine learning algorithms for analyzing biological data to produce biological insights about cell health and rejuvenation with an emphasis on causal discovery, lab-in-the-loop and multi-modal integration. Qualifications: Expert in computational biology and machine learning with over 10 years of experience in computational biology. Typically, PhD in machine learning, statistics, computational biology or related fields.What We Want You To Know We are a culture of collaboration and scientific freedom, and we believe in the values of diversity, inclusion and belonging to inspire innovation. Altos Labs provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training. Altos currently requires all employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19, subject to legally required exemptions (e.g., due to a medical condition or sincerely-held religious belief). Thank you for your interest in Altos Labs where we strive for a culture of Scientific Freedom, Learning, and Belonging. Note: Altos Labs will not ask you to download a messaging app for an interview or outlay your own money to get started as an employee. If this sounds like your interaction with people claiming to be with Altos, it is not legitimate and has nothing to do with Altos. Job-Title: Research Scientist in Quantum Machine Learning
Description:
ABOUT INSTADEEPInsta

Deep Ltd is an EMEA leader in decision-making AI products for the Enterprise, with headquarters in London, and offices in Paris, Tunis, Lagos, Dubai and Cape Town. Leveraging its extensive know-how in GPU-accelerated computing, deep learning and AI-enhanced bioinformatics, Insta Deep has built products and solutions that tackle the most complex challenges across a range of industries. The firm‚Äôs hands-on approach to research, combined with a broad spectrum of clients, ensures an exciting and rewarding environment to work and thrive in.

Insta Deep has also developed collaborations with global leaders in the Artificial intelligence ecosystem, and is backed by investors including Google and BioNTech.

JOB DESCRIPTION

Insta

Deep is looking for Research Scientists to join our Research Team in London working on the intersection of quantum computing (QC) and machine learning (ML). Recent advances in QC have moved the field from nascent theoretical studies to... practical implementations on Noisy Intermediate-Scale Quantum (NISQ) devices that can even outperform modern supercomputers on contrived tasks. In this paradigm, hybrid classical-quantum systems are already being developed for tasks as varied as the modelling of quantum systems, classical optimisation, and the broad interdisciplinary field of quantum machine learning (QML).Insta

Deep has always sought to apply novel approaches to the hardest and highest impact challenges in the world, and the QML Team is supporting this through the study and adoption of emerging quantum technologies. As a Research Scientist you will bring demonstrated expertise to help shape and deliver the research agenda of the QML team. ROLE RESPONSIBILITIES Develop novel research and help to shape Insta Deep‚Äôs agenda within the field of quantum computing and quantum machine learning.

Contribute to team research and publications.

Explore potential applications of quantum technologies to practical challenges such as combinatorial optimisation, molecular simulation and drug discovery.

Develop collaborations with both academic and industrial partners.

Track ongoing developments in quantum algorithms, applications and hardware.

Report and present experimental results and research findings, both internally and externally, verbally and in writing. Upon request, collaborate with other groups‚Äô activities, including but not limited to presenting the company to new prospective clients, participating in calls and meetings, and representing Instadeep in conferences/events.

REQUIREMENTS PhD in quantum physics, computer science, machine learning or a related scientific field.

Proven ability to contribute to research communities and/or efforts, including publishing scientific papers in leading journals or conferences.

Software development skills in Python.

DESIRABLE QUALIFICATIONS Knowledge of, and practical experience with, machine learning and NISQ devices.

Experience with quantum computing libraries such as Penny Lane, Qiskit or Cirq.

Experience applying quantum computational, or quantum-inspired, approaches to quantum chemistry, combinatorial optimisation, bioinformatics or drug discovery.

BENEFITS Competitive salary.

Working in small, diverse teams where you can make an impact and grow fast.

Collaborate with world-leaders in both research and applications

Responsibilities

TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy.
Our TikTok recommendation team is responsible for developing state-of-the-art machine learning models and strategies to improve user consumption experience, inspire creativity, build a fair and flourishing ecosystem.

-Build industry leading recommendation system, develop highly scalable classifiers and tools leveraging machine learning
-Understand product objectives and machine learning techniques, improve model and recommendation strategy

-Strong communication and teamwork skills

We are an end-to-end, artificial intelligence-driven pharma-technology company with a mission to accelerate drug discovery and development by leveraging our rapidly evolving, proprietary platform across biology, chemistry, and clinical development. Our Pharma.AI platform has the potential to rapidly bring novel breakthrough medicines to patients while decreasing costs and increasing the probabilities of success.

The candidate will

‚Ä¢ Propose various solutions to improve the predictive performance of the models and the predictive pipeline
‚Ä¢ Make experiments (i.e., build predictive models) with the provided dataset

Desirable skills

Please send your CV to career@insilicomedicine.com

WovenLight's vision is to inject data and analytics into both the core of value creation at portfolio companies, and how we ourselves operate as an investment firm. To execute our mission we are building an integrated team of world class investment, operating and technology professionals. If you are excited about working with us to build the next generation private equity firm we would love to hear from you.

As a Principal Machine Learning Engineer, you will lead the development of technical solutions that help WovenLight create value across its portfolio. You will play a key role on individual projects for portfolio companies, as well as contributing to investment tools that underpin our approach across the investment lifecycle.

You will lead teams through the design, development and deployment of machine learning systems into production, being responsible for architecture, code quality and engineering design. You will balance hands-on work with team leadership responsibilities... depending on the context of the specific project.

Examples of projects you could work on include:
‚Ä¢ Optimisation modelling to improve manufacturing throughput
‚Ä¢ Predictive modelling to anticipate/avoid asset downtime
‚Ä¢ Predicting and reducing customer churn
‚Ä¢ Identifying next best action for sales agents
‚Ä¢ Geospatial modelling to improve store footprint

Our internal investment tools use multiple data sources and ML algorithms to help our investment team improve the sourcing and selection of new portfolio companies.

You will work on these projects in integrated teams of technical and business-facing colleagues, while also collaborating with our investment team. You will apply a combination of leadership skills and deep technical expertise in data, infrastructure, ML algorithms and software engineering to deliver high quality technical solutions. You will also be involved to the alignment of scope, distribution of tasks, estimation of timelines and tracking of progress across the lifetime of the projects.

You will act as line manager for more junior WovenLight engineers, being responsible for coaching and mentoring them. You will also support our portfolio companies as they build and scale their ML teams internally. You should be comfortable giving and receiving feedback, as well as helping set personal development objectives.

The successful candidate should have the following attributes:
‚Ä¢ Passion and expertise in developing, deploying and monitoring ML algorithms to deliver commercial impact ‚Äì ideally 6+ years of experience
‚Ä¢ Experience coaching and managing engineers
‚Ä¢ Excellent communication skills - able to explain complex analytical concepts to people from other fields
‚Ä¢ Expertise in Python and a deep knowledge of the Python ML stack (e.g. numpy, pandas, scikit-learn, pytorch / tensorflow))
‚Ä¢ Experience in the full development lifecycle of APIs, containerised (micro-)services, SDKs, and CLIs
‚Ä¢ Experience with one or more of the following tools & technologies:
‚Ä¢ Cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure or GCP
‚Ä¢ Data pipelining frameworks (e.g. Airflow, Kedro),
‚Ä¢ MLOps platforms (e.g. Databricks, Kubeflow, GCP Vertex)
‚Ä¢ Databases and data processing languages & tools, e.g. SQL (py-)Spark

Our core team is based in London. Interviews for this role will be conducted via a combination of phone, video-conference and in person.

WovenLight is committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of sex, race, religion, ethnicity, nationality, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other basis as protected by applicable law

Working as a Machine Learning Engineer you will be responsible for end-to-end model pipelines, from building upon pre-existing image data and labelling pipelines to produce high quality datasets, to monitoring and setting up automated retraining pipelines, using best practices in Machine Learning Operations (MLOps) and DevOps. You will be responsible for building and deploying bespoke Computer Vision based Machine Learning (ML) models using an AWS service-led architecture which processes photos from ultra-high-resolution imaging booths. You will be responsible for using Machine learning (ML) to convert this data into useful information that creates value for customers. The role is offered on a hybrid basis with some office and some home-based working - it is NOT a remote role and therefore you will need to live within a commutable distance of Exeter, Devon, England, to be considered for the vacancy or be in a position to relocate to the area to allow you work at the office each... week.

Duties The main deliverables of the role are: Deliver performant machine learning models for customers. Write production-grade code for serving machine learning models, using industry best practices for model deployment. Building capabilities to monitor and evaluate model performance and metrics. Train detection, segmentation and/or classification machine learning models. Write production, robust, readable and extendable code to support machine learning pipelines. Use industry best practices and seek to implement improvements across the machine learning lifecycle (MLOps). Support customers with both regular and ad-hoc performance analysis as required. Support customer queries, proactively seek technical solutions that solve customer problems and react to customer feedback. Keep up to date with latest developments in machine learning for customer applications. Developing and championing robust MLOps frameworks and policies. Training and maintaining performant vehicle segmentation models. Labelling tasks and data quality. Designing and implementing reporting dashboards. Developing novel approaches from academic and industry research. Production model deployment and maintenance.Required Skills Strong knowledge of Python (numpy, pandas, seaborn, matplotlib, dvc, streamlit, opencv). Strong knowledge of modern programming paradigms (i.e., OOP, functional programming). Ability to write clean, robust, readable, error handling and error tolerant code. Good knowledge of at least one of the following, PyTorch, Keras, Tensorflow, Nvidia TAO (TLT). Working knowledge of core AWS concepts and services such as EC2, ECS, EKS, RDS, Cloudwatch, Quicksight and others. Good knowledge of DevOps and MLOps tools, including usage of Git, Bash, Unix, CI/CD pipelines (GitHub Actions or similar). Technical understanding of convolutional neural network architecture (CNNs) including YOLOv4/v5, Detectron2 or similar. Technical knowledge of relevant ML performance metrics and how to apply them to monitor model performance. Able to work effectively both as part of a team and individually.Benefits Very competitive salary and benefits, including: 37.5 hours per week, Monday to Friday (flexible on early/late starts). 25 days holiday per annum + bank holidays. Life Assurance & Death in Service (4x basic salary).

Additional days holiday for birthday. Company sick pay scheme. Cycle to work scheme. Electric Vehicle salary sacrifice scheme. Enhanced maternity, paternity and shared parental leave. KEYWORDS Machine Learning Engineer, Machine Learning, Computer Vision, Machine Learning Operations MLOps, DevOps, Python, OOP, Functional Programming, Coding, PyTorch, Keras, Tensorflow, Nvidia TAO, AWS, EC2, ECS, EKS, RDS, Cloudwatch, Quicksight, Neural Network Architecture (CNN) Please note that due to a high level of applications, we can only respond to applicants whose skills and qualifications are suitable for this position.

No terminology in this advert is intended to discriminate against any of the protected characteristics that fall under the Equality Act 2010. Bowerford Associates Ltd is acting as an Employment Agency in relation to this vacancy

Canopy is a brand-new company with a unique mission, solving for one of the biggest and growing challenges vehicle owners face ‚Äì the threat of theft. A start-up with a compelling proposition, patented cutting-edge AI technology, and a unique layer of expert monitoring from security specialists, we‚Äôre backed by Ford and ADT. Together, we‚Äôre determined to help vehicle owners stay one step ahead of potential threats by warning them before they happen. Our next step is to take our service to market and write the next big security technology success story. We‚Äôre all in. Are you?

The Canopy team is a global product team delivering connected security solutions for vehicles which deliver customers ultimate peace of mind. Benefits

Description We are growing rapidly, and looking for a talented Site Reliability engineer to join our team of engineers, designers, and data scientists to work on the development and maintenance of the Faculty Platform.

The Role

You will be working with truly cutting-edge technology which underpins a new generation of machine learning products produced tooling you develop will make possible the delivery of high-impact AI applications which are robust, highly available and trusted by our customers.

Description: A Post-Doctoral Research Associate in Machine Learning for Organic Materials position is available within the ¬£10 M Centre for Functional Materials Design, with the main focus to develop cutting edge computational methodologies with a primary focus in organic chemistry within the research group of Professor Andrew Cooper.We are open to applications from scientists who will contribute at both a technical and strategic level to the project and build on recent work; e.g., Nature, 2020, 583, 237; Science, 2019, 366, 613; Nat. Comput. Sci., 2021, 1, 290; Nat. Commun., 2021, 12, 817. We seek candidates with expertise in machine learning, computer science or computational physical science, and we are open to applications from across chemistry, physics and materials science. The top-level responsibilities, depending on your expertise, will be as follows:‚Ä¢ Machine learning: direct experience in Bayesian (or other black-box) optimisation, deep learning, and/or reinforcement learning, applied to chemical data, experimental or computational.‚Ä¢ Molecular modelling: adequate experience in (ab initio) molecular dynamics (MD) and, more desirably, MD augmented by machine/deep learning based interatomic potentials.‚Ä¢ Computational chemistry: in-depth knowledge and extensive experience in electronic-structure calculations, particularly applied to predict molecular or solid-state materials properties.You should have a PhD in Computer Science, Robotics, Chemistry, Chemical Engineering, Physics, or Materials Science. Job-Title: Director/Principal Scientist in Computational Biology, Data Science and...
Description:
Job Description

We are a research-driven biopharmaceutical company. Our mission is built on the simple premise that if we ‚Äúfollow the science‚Äù that great medicines can make a significant impact to our world. We believe that a research-driven enterprise dedicated to world-class science can succeed by inventing medicine and vaccine innovations that make a difference for patients across the globe. We identify and target steps in disease mechanisms or pathways that could be inhibited or enhanced. Our goal is to identify a compound that is effective against a disease target. Using innovative thinking, state-of-the-art facilities and robust scientific methodology we collaborate to discover the next medical breakthrough.

We have exciting plans to establish a new state-of the-art Research and Discovery Centre in London‚Äôs ‚ÄòKnowledge Quarter‚Äô opposite King‚Äôs Cross Railway station. Our new site, expected to be completed within the next 5 years, will employ circa 800 people across our research... and commercial divisions.

We are seeking highly motivated Director/Principal Scientist in Computational Biology, Data Science and Machine Learning to join growing Integrative Genomics group at our London Discovery Centre.

The successful candidate will play a leading role in identifying, developing, and deploying cutting-edge computational and machine learning methods to deliver insights in broad spectrum of diseases. They will partner across Data and Genome Science groups, and IT departments to implement foundational algorithms and leverage machine learning methods for delineating causal biology and target selection. As a project leader, they will set priorities and goals for their teams and work side-by-side with them to solve complex research problems. As a senior leader in the group, they will mentor, coach, and train group members. The successful candidate will need to communicate effectively in diverse matrix environment spanning data and genome sciences, machine learning and IT teams. They will also need to regularly update key stakeholders and senior leadership. This role is central in providing vision and continuity across a diverse group of innovative researchers who are driving the next revolution in drug discovery. The candidate will also be expected to advance their internal and external scientific profile through presentation at key internal forums, external engagements and peer-reviewed publications.

What you will do:
‚Ä¢ Develop and implement predictive modeling methods for target and biomarker discovery, and multi omics data integration
‚Ä¢ Engage with senior leaders and peers to set group strategy for machine learning adoption and implementation
‚Ä¢ Use modern AI/ML and statistical methods to drive analysis of genomics, genetics, imaging and other relevant data types across multiple therapy areas
‚Ä¢ Co-lead target discovery projects across therapy areas and functional lines
‚Ä¢ Provide technical leadership for machine learning projects across Data & Genome Sciences
‚Ä¢ Actively develops talent, fosters a high-performance culture of collaboration, engagement, self-accountability, and inclusion
‚Ä¢ Lead due diligence and evaluation of external partnerships in AI/ML
‚Ä¢ Present at key internal and external meetings, national and international conferences, publish in leading journals

Qualifications, Skills & Experience Required:
‚Ä¢ PhD (with 8+ years in pharma, biotech, or academic settings; MS +12 years of experience) in Computational Biology, Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, Statistics, Physics, or a related discipline
‚Ä¢ Demonstrated expertise in applying modern computational and AI/ML approaches to multi-omics data analysis and biological data integration
‚Ä¢ Strong hands-on skills in relevant programming languages (e.g., Python, R)
‚Ä¢ Expertise with ML and statistical approaches (e.g. Scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch), collaborative software development
‚Ä¢ Experience leading teams to implement novel computational methods to solve complex research challenges
‚Ä¢ Competent working in Linux environment, cloud computing or HPC
‚Ä¢ Experience in Neuroscience, Immunology or Cardiometabolic diseases is highly desirable
‚Ä¢ Experience in modelling multi-omics clinical and functional genomics data (e.g. Bayesian Inference) in highly desirable
‚Ä¢ Experience in development and application of NLP methodologies is highly desirable
‚Ä¢ Demonstrated passion for team building, a track record of talent development
‚Ä¢ A champion for diverse and inclusive cultures

We are proud to be a company that embraces the value of bringing diverse, talented, and committed people together. The fastest way to breakthrough innovation is when diverse ideas come together in an inclusive environment. We encourage our colleagues to respectfully challenge one another‚Äôs thinking and approach problems collectively. We are an equal opportunity employer, committed to fostering an inclusive and diverse workplace.

Who we are ‚Ä¶
We are known as Merck & Co., Inc., Rahway, New Jersey, USA in the United States and Canada and MSD everywhere else. For more than a century, we have been inventing for life, bringing forward medicines and vaccines for many of the world's most challenging diseases. Today, our company continues to be at the forefront of research to deliver innovative health solutions and advance the prevention and treatment of diseases that threaten people and animals around the world.

What we look for ‚Ä¶
Imagine getting up in the morning for a job as important as helping to save and improve lives around the world. Here, you have that opportunity. You can put your empathy, creativity, digital mastery, or scientific genius to work in collaboration with a diverse group of colleagues who pursue and bring hope to countless people who are battling some of the most challenging diseases of our time. Our team is constantly evolving, so if you are among the intellectually curious, join us‚Äîand start making your impact today.

Leading online retail into the future

Ocado Technology is powering the future of online retail across the globe through disruptive innovation and automation. Join us to create world-class systems at the intersection of robotics and IoT, cloud platforms, big data, machine learning, software development, and beyond.

We're constantly reinventing ourselves, learning fast, evolving our craftsmanship and taking risks as we strive to fulfil our mission to change the way the world shops. About the role:

Data Scientists and Machine Learning Engineers within the Fulfilment department research, design and build models & algorithms to optimise decisions. This covers areas across In-Store Fulfilment (where we continuously look for ways to further optimise manual order picking) and CFC (our highly automated fulfilment centres). We are looking for a Machine Learning Scientist specialised in Reinforcement Learning who can play a key role in evolving our autonomous bot control systems through the development and deployment of novel algorithms.

We operate over 10k bots worldwide - in 2022 they made over 15 billion individual moves and travelled a combined 72 million kilometres - being at a considerable scale for benefiting from potential efficiency gains.

This is an amazing opportunity for the right individual to make a significant and lasting impact in the way Ocado operates and thinks about its core technology product. You should think about applying if you‚Äôre passionate about novel applications of bleeding edge machine learning in solving some of the biggest problems facing e-retailers the world over. Your background might be academia or equivalent practical experience with multi-agent path planning.

The role will report to the Head of Data in Fulfilment but will be given the appropriate latitude and autonomy to focus purely on this outcome in combination with a cross-business working group - the scope for career advancement and further opportunity for the right individual being significant across the entire Ocado Technology business. Roles and responsibilities will include:
Designing, implementing and evaluating models, agents and prototypes of multi-agent control systems based on Reinforcement Learning techniques

Working with product managers to ensure projects are properly scoped, planned and executed, so there is successful utilisation of research outputs

Collaborating with engineering teams to improve our control systems

Report and present findings and developments to technical and non-technical stakeholders

What we‚Äôre looking for:

PhD in a technical field or equivalent practical experience. PhD in Reinforcement Learning would be an advantage

Relevant experience to the position, such as working on applications of reinforcement learning in control systems

Experience with controlled experimentation methods and A/B testing

Someone who is curious and is comfortable thinking outside the box Someone who is passionate about AIThis is an incredible opportunity to play a pivotal role in advancing our world leading automated solution and push the boundaries of what AI can do in retail fulfilment.

Hybrid working (2 days in the office )30 day work from anywhere policy

Data Analytics at J.P. Morgan Corporate Investment Bank combines cutting edge machine learning techniques with the company's unique data assets to optimize all the business decisions we make. Data da Publica√ß√£o: Jan 25 2023

AI/ML Engineer ‚Äì Sequence Learning

At GSK we see a world in which advanced applications of artificial intelligence and machine learning (AI/ML) will allow us to develop novel therapies to existing diseases and to quickly respond to emerging or changing diseases with personalized drugs, driving better outcomes at reduced cost with fewer side effects. It is an ambitious vision that will require the development of products and solutions at the cutting edge of AI/ML. If that excites you, we'd love to chat.

The AI/ML Sequence Learning Team applies machine learning and AI methods to biological sequence (DNA, RNA, protein) data from large-scale human genetic, functional genomic and single cell experiments. Models operating directly on sequence data that can infer how variants alter protein/RNA abundance, structure and function have the potential to be transformative in drug discovery, empowering us to find new life... saving medicines.

We're looking for a highly accomplished AI/ML Engineer to help us make this vision a reality. Competitive candidates will have a track record of shipping high performing AI/ML powered products in production environments. They are highly accomplished Machine Learning Engineers, with breadth across machine learning methods, as well as depth in at least one area. Additionally, they are accomplished software engineers with a track record of shipping stable, tested, performant code and services in an agile environment.

Strong candidates will have graduate studies in computer science, applied mathematics, or the equivalent, and a passion for solving challenging problems in artificial intelligence and machine learning. Educational or professional background in the biological sciences is a plus; passion to help therapies for new and existing diseases, and a pattern of continuous learning and development is mandatory.

The AI/ML team is built on the principles of ownership, accountability, continuous development, and collaboration. We hire for the long term, and we're motivated to make this a great place to work. Our leaders will be committed to your career and development from day one.

We‚Äôre combining the power of genetic and genomic insights into what causes disease, with the speed and scale of AI/ML to make better predictions about who a treatment might work for, and why. We believe this powerful combination of data and technology holds the key to fundamentally transforming medical discovery for the better, improving R&D success rates and shaping how even the most challenging diseases, like neurological conditions and cancer, can be both prevented and treated.

In 2021 we delivered four major product approvals: Cabenuva for HIV, Jemperli for endometrial cancer, Xevudy for COVID-19 and Apretude, our new long-acting medicine for HIV prevention.

‚Ä¢ Leverage the expertise of more senior team mates to continuously develop understanding of scientific, machine learning and software engineering best practice in the organisation, to construct robust, tested, production-grade software products with well-characterised performance and limitations

Uniting science, technology and talent to get ahead of disease together

GSK is a global biopharma company with a special purpose ‚Äì to unite science, technology and talent to get ahead of disease together ‚Äì so we can positively impact the health of billions of people and deliver stronger, more sustainable shareholder returns ‚Äì as an organization where people can thrive. Getting ahead means preventing disease as well as treating it, and we aim to impact the health of 2.5 billion people around the world in the next 10 years.

Our success absolutely depends on our people. While getting ahead of disease together is about our ambition for patients and shareholders, it‚Äôs also about making GSK a place where people can thrive. Posted Date: Jan 19 2023

Over the last 18 months, we‚Äôve seen how critical the healthcare industry is to society. If you would love to be part of making a difference, then consider joining us and applying for our Sr. Data Science Engineer opportunity.

You would be supporting new GSK‚Äôs purpose of uniting science, talent, and technology to get ahead of disease together. Our purpose is to develop tools, models, and processes to enable scientists to create preventative products such as vaccines or discover ways to treat illnesses such as therapeutics. We also support the equally important development of robust and efficient manufacturing of such products. Examples of specific areas of interest include delivering end-to-end biomarker data pipelines; delivering integrated data analytics environments to aid scientists in... target identification or models that drive more efficient cell line development. We are a team with an ambition to be at the cutting edge of the pharmaceutical industry data science and engineering. So, as an R&D department with a passion for using data to solve problems and improve patient care, why wouldn‚Äôt you consider working for us?

Our organization is built on the principles of ownership, accountability, continuous development, and collaboration. Our leaders are committed to your career and development from day one. You will be working in a stimulating and supportive environment as part of a dynamic, growing community. You will have access to our Learning & Development resources, comprising a blend of on-the-job learning with targeted coaching, peer-to-peer mentoring, expert-led workshops, and a network of learning providers.

The Team?

The Data Science and Visualization team (DSV) is an experienced team of data scientists and software engineers that focuses on the creation and deployment of leading-edge, reusable data science microservices and products. This might be the creation of genetic and genomic data science products, changing the decision cycle time for our biopharmaceuticals, or accelerating assets in clinical trials through smart site selection and forecasting. The ease of use and interpretation in the hands of the scientist is very important to us, hence the emphasis upon not just the data science but the visualization.

The Role?

The Sr. Data Science Engineer is a hands-on position where you will be empowered to be creative, ambitious and bold. You will translate a business need into a well-defined machine learning problem and execute on that solution alone or in a team. You will be able to actively identify opportunities to apply machine learning to build, test, and validate predictive models. The Sr. Data Science Engineer will be the standard-bearer for good coding practices and promote proper unit, functional, and integration tests for code to ensure quality.

As a Sr. Data Science Engineer, you will:
‚Ä¢ Evaluate the appropriateness of the data for the intended task, designing models that perform to specification, and be able to evaluate the model (architectures, cost-functions, etc.) that will best suit the problem at hand.
‚Ä¢ Compare results from various methodologies and recommend the best techniques to stakeholders
‚Ä¢ Think in advance of a model's future requirements or how the available data might change over time and design a product that will be able to cope with those requirements. Assume leadership of some, or all, of a product ship.
‚Ä¢ Be the ‚Äògo to‚Äô leader in specific methodologies and mentor junior data scientists on the team and share ideas in an open collegiate way.
‚Ä¢ Connect and collaborate with subject matter experts in biology, chemistry, and medicine and offer, challenge, and solicit advice via peer review to enhance quality, share best practices and embed innovation.
‚Ä¢ Be a model leader in code practice and standards
‚Ä¢ Independently translate high-level ideas into reliable, production stable ad testable products, services or features, despite rapidly changing standards, solutions and technology
‚Ä¢ Strive for bringing innovation and help building the bridge between data science and molecular biology. Continuously enrich your knowledge with the latest advancements in these fields.

Why you?

Basic Qualifications:

We are looking for professionals with these required skills to achieve our goals:
‚Ä¢ BS Degree (Mathematics or Engineering, Data Science/ML, Statistics, Computer Science, Physics, Computational Biology, Computational Chemistry.) with 7+ years of experience (or MS with 5+ years of experience, or PhD with 3+ years of experience) in the biotech/pharmaceutical/ healthcare/diagnostics/health insurance space
‚Ä¢ Experience designing, developing and implementing analytical solutions using a variety of commercial and open-source tools.
‚Ä¢ Experience comparing results from various methodologies then explaining the technical concepts at all levels in the organization, including senior managers/stakeholders.
‚Ä¢ Experience creating algorithms to extract information from large, multiparametric data sets and deploy them into production to realize significant value.
‚Ä¢ Experience in manipulating data in a big data environment ‚Äì being able to use Hive, SQL and the like would be an advantage. Ability to account for model or data drifts to ensure models continue to deliver value.
‚Ä¢ Deep expertise with agile development in Python
‚Ä¢ Deep experience with DevOps tools and concepts e.g. Jira, GitHub)
‚Ä¢ Deep expertise in data science and machine learning
‚Ä¢ Experience mentoring junior engineers in technical work

Preferred Qualifications:

If you have the following characteristics, it would be a plus:
‚Ä¢ 5+ years of experience in the development of interpretable machine learning to production using a programming language such as Python or R.
‚Ä¢ Experience in delivering solutions to production via Continuous Integration/Continuous Delivery.

Our values and expectations are at the heart of everything we do and form an important part of our culture. Our success absolutely depends on our people. Job ID: A2222445

We are combining the best of human and machine intelligence to accelerate the discovery of advanced medicines.

At LabGenius, headquartered in London, our mission is to accelerate the discovery of next-generation therapeutic antibodies. To do this, we‚Äôre pioneering the development of a smart robotic platform that‚Äôs capable of designing, conducting and, critically, learning from its own experiments.

We believe this approach will radically improve the drug discovery process, making the generation of advanced antibody therapeutics faster.

LabGenius‚Äô highly multidisciplinary team brings together the very best minds from the fields of data science, robotic automation, protein engineering, synthetic biology.

As Senior Machine Learning Engineer at LabGenius, you will drive the development and deployment of our machine learning pipeline and be responsible for building a scalable product that can support all LabGenius drug discovery programs. This will include the development of a Bayesian... Optimisation pipeline that proposes new experiments for our Design-Build-Test-Learn cycle. We‚Äôre focused on systematic exploration of the protein fitness landscape to build predictive models of function and developability characteristics. Our mission is to create medicines that are potent, safe, and life-enhancing for patients.

Our Data Science and Bioinformatics team guides which experiments we run and designs the protein variants we test. In the long term, we see opportunities for data science across the biotherapeutic discovery process, from target selection to drug discovery to pre-clinical development. In the immediate future we‚Äôre focused on computational biology and machine learning for discovery and lead optimisation of antibody therapeutics.

What You‚Äôll Do In This Role
‚Ä¢ Implement and deploy state-of-the-art machine learning methods with a focus on developing feature representations for our designed proteins and Bayesian Optimisation methods for predicting and optimising protein function and developability
‚Ä¢ Support the deployment these models within our biotherapeutic discovery campaigns to efficiently explore the design space
‚Ä¢ Develop robust data preprocessing pipelines
‚Ä¢ Bring your wealth of expertise to our team, providing mentorship and sharing best practice
‚Ä¢ Identify and pursue opportunities to improve our platform, based on what‚Äôs going on in industry and academia

What We‚Äôre Looking For
‚Ä¢ Good knowledge of computational Bayesian statistics & experience with sample-efficient machine learning methods for smaller datasets
‚Ä¢ Experience with iterative design / combinatorial optimisation problems and Bayesian Optimisation and relevant technology such as BoTorch / GPyTorch or similar
‚Ä¢ Extensive experience with machine learning and related skills such as model validation
‚Ä¢ Good knowledge of mathematics & algorithms
‚Ä¢ Good python programming skills & experience writing production-grade code
‚Ä¢ Experience with databases & SQL
‚Ä¢ You have extensive experience in industry as a senior machine learning engineer / data scientist or multiple years of postdoctoral experience with demonstrable software skills

Nice to have
‚Ä¢ Knowledge of representation learning (for sequences) and/or mathematical foundations of kernel methods
‚Ä¢ Experience with latent variable methods such as variational inference
‚Ä¢ You have computational biology expertise, including predictions of protein function or developability
‚Ä¢ You have experience in a drug discovery environment
‚Ä¢ Familiarity with version control, Google cloud, and common ML Ops tools
‚Ä¢ You have helped build a data-driven culture, equipping your colleagues with the skills and tools they need to use data in their day-to-day job

Every functional area, in every industry, is on an AI Journey. The power of machine learning to dramatically improve company key performance indicators is being proven every day. But, although we feel every large organisation is on an AI journey, the path to value is unclear.

There are three key barriers to deploying AI and machine learning at scale:
‚Ä¢ Building data pipelines that feed both the development and deployment of machine learning models
‚Ä¢ Improving consistency, reducing effort and expanding the ability of data scientists to address the growing range of business problems from prediction to prescription
‚Ä¢ Building out the necessary infrastructure to support 100s of machine learning models in production, including the necessary governance and compliance patterns

At Cognizant we are proud to be helping our clients on their journey to AI at scale... We've built practices that bring together the best talent to address these key barriers, and have built unique capability to complement our people:
‚Ä¢ Our Adaptive Data Foundation brings together our accelerators, partnerships and consulting approach to help clients solve the increasing demands for data
‚Ä¢ Our Evolutionary AI technology and patents is reducing the effort required to develop deep learning and other sophisticated models. It's particularly adept at addressing prescription problems, from marketing to next best action to supply chain
‚Ä¢ Our architecture frameworks help clients navigate technology choices throughout the AI process. As well as building capability in close collaboration with the leading cloud providers, we are working with startups that address the critical engineering challenges that machine learning brings

Data Scientists and Machine Learning Engineers within the Fulfilment department research, design and build models & algorithms to optimise decisions. ‚Ä¢ Experience with controlled experimentation methods and A/B testing
‚Ä¢ Someone who is curious and is comfortable thinking outside the box
‚Ä¢ Someone who is passionate about AI

This is an incredible opportunity to play a pivotal role in advancing our world leading automated solution and push the boundaries of what AI can do in retail fulfilment.

The ML Researcher will have access to our rich, curated, proprietary genomics data of patient derived cell lines, we believe to be the largest of its kind globally. The ML Researcher will take ownership of defining the ML direction for this research and pushing the boundaries of the state of the art. Collaborating within this multi-disciplinary team (bioinformaticians, wet lab scientists, clinicians, AI scientists) you will see the impact this research has for discovering new therapies for drastically better patient outcomes.

CoSyne Therapeutics is a computational drug discovery company that uses genetic and computational systems to develop next-generation medicines. The company‚Äôs first goal is to create a new class of drugs to treat the deadliest form of human brain cancer: Glioblastoma Multiforme. Our novel platform allows us to identify vulnerabilities in cells that no other company or academic institution has done before.

CoSyne recently closed a substantial seed funding round... from industry-leading investors and the company is looking to grow the functional genomics and machine learning team. The Lead ML Researcher will be a key member of the AI and computational biology teams and will help develop machine learning methods for the discovery of novel drug targets. Working with the bioinformatics and wet lab teams you will be responsible for the development of computational analysis frameworks from the significant volume of data arising from our in-house functional genomic screens.

The successful candidate will join an enthusiastic and collaborative team based in our Soho London office. As part of a well-funded start-up, the role holder will have all the resources necessary to make the science work, will have excellent opportunities to grow their skills, and will work with a truly fantastic team to develop therapeutics to treat currently incurable diseases.

Main activities will involve:
‚Ä¢ Create and develop innovative AI tools to mine CoSyne‚Äôs diverse data sets to find novel drug targets that will impact patients' lives.
‚Ä¢ Building state-of-the-art machine learning models to find novel drug targets from the in-house genomics data
‚Ä¢ Implement and productionise novel machine learning solutions.
‚Ä¢ Develop robust model validation pipelines.
‚Ä¢ Gathering and enacting on technical requirements from the bioinformatics team.
‚Ä¢ Reporting directly to the CTO

We are interested in speaking with you if you have some of the following:
‚Ä¢ At least 3 years‚Äô experience as a machine learning researcher.
‚Ä¢ Masters‚Äô degree + good commercial experience or PhD in Computer Science/AI/Mathematics/Physics or another relevant field
‚Ä¢ Experience working with Genomic or genetic data; ideally, this includes expression profiling, WGS or functional genomic data.
‚Ä¢ Curious and creative approach to work and someone who is a self-starter.
‚Ä¢ Experience working in a multidisciplinary team
‚Ä¢ Experience implementing machine learning algorithms in Tensorflow and/or Pytorch
‚Ä¢ Good understanding on machine learning methods, including but not limited to
‚Ä¢ Bayesian causal inference
‚Ä¢ Mutual Information
‚Ä¢ Graphical Models

Benefits:
‚Ä¢ As an early employee of the company you will be involved in every aspect of the business and help set the direction/culture as we grow.
‚Ä¢ The opportunity to work at the cutting edge of genomics and drug discovery.
‚Ä¢ We are building a highly multidisciplinary team and are focused on breaking down silos between the lab and computational biology.
‚Ä¢ Membership to CoSyne‚Äôs Equity scheme.
‚Ä¢ All the perks of a start-up ‚Äì highly competitive salaries, great IT, team dinners/socials, flexible working, flat structure, and a dynamic work environment.

Our mission is to help patients with devastating diseases. Everything else is secondary.

We interview on a rolling basis and so this role will be filled when we find the right candidate

Company Overview

We believe we are the UK‚Äôs most exciting ML start-up and one of the fastest growing businesses around, having recently secured $62 million in series-B funding. At Speechmatics, we train billion parameter neural networks to help us understand audio, language and how humans communicate. Whilst doing so, we regularly win customers from Google, Amazon and Microsoft by selling the world's most accurate speech-recognition. Our mission is to understand every voice, regardless of language, accent or background; actively researching ways to mitigate bias.

The Role

As the Machine Learning Team Lead, you will have the influence to pioneer new cutting-edge research into some of the most exciting and challenging deep learning problems, tackling bias in AI, enhancing diversity within speech engines, and building new tools and environments for ground-breaking Automatic Speech Recognition (ASR).

Strategically, this will be one of the most important hires we make, as you will be... leading the ‚ÄòRepresentations Team‚Äô who focus on representation and self-supervised learning within the context of speech. The successful candidate will be able to evolve our already state-of-the-art approach to reach even greater levels of accuracy and efficiency, advance our research direction and ambitions, and bring next-generation Speech products to market. Specific speech experience is beneficial, but not necessary.

You will need to be experienced in (and have a desire to): define a best-in-class machine learning vision and strategy, develop and grow your team of elite machine learning experts, be a role model across the AI division, and champion people‚Äôs perspectives, promoting a diverse and inclusive culture. As our Chief ML Engineer, this should be something that you care deeply about; helping others flourish and fuelling your team‚Äôs professional growth.

What You'll Be Doing
‚Ä¢ Leading by example and inspiring through a clear, productive and influential voice
‚Ä¢ Building on proof-of-concept innovations from our research team to fit customer requirements and making machine learning innovations of your own to answer customer needs, integrating both into our product lines
‚Ä¢ Playing a critical role in setting your team‚Äôs technical direction
‚Ä¢ Driving the long-term direction of our products with the architect‚Äôs support
‚Ä¢ Providing honest and constructive feedback into our products‚Äô design
‚Ä¢ Taking part in high level planning and team resourcing
‚Ä¢ Striving to strike the right balance between producing output and allocating time to long-term high-impact projects
‚Ä¢ Reviewing your team‚Äôs code
‚Ä¢ Promoting your team‚Äôs work across the organization including non-technical teams
‚Ä¢ Promoting team cohesiveness, a positive culture and good team spirit
‚Ä¢ Attracting and hiring the right talent

Who We Are Looking For
‚Ä¢ You will have existing experience supervising or managing a team, delivering complex projects together successfully
‚Ä¢ You will have conducted research into an exciting and relevant field, such as (but not exclusive to): self-supervised learning or acoustic modelling
‚Ä¢ You will be naturally curious, continually striving to make an impact
‚Ä¢ You‚Äôll be inclusive, show empathy, and champion your team
‚Ä¢ You will be a problem solver who can apply your skills to technical issues
‚Ä¢ You are constantly thinking about how your team, product and outcomes can improve
‚Ä¢ You‚Äôll be an excellent communicator, connecting and collaborating with teams across the company
‚Ä¢ You will challenge and encourage ideas
‚Ä¢ You‚Äôll have experience working with standard speech or machine learning toolkits
‚Ä¢ You‚Äôll have solid Python, C++ and/or Shell skills
‚Ä¢ And you will obsess over keeping things simple

What We Can Offer You

Job-Title: Vision Analytics Deep Learning Model Developer
Description:
WE ARE VERITONE

We are driven by the belief that Artificial Intelligence is mankind‚Äôs greatest invention. It is the key to building a safer, more vibrant, transparent, and empowered society. We are determined to be an active contributor to shaping our future for the better. We care about the ethical implications of AI and the prosperity and well-being of all individuals, as well as the growth and continued successes of our employees, customers, and partners.

Veritone‚Äôs mission today is more important than ever. We‚Äôre here to democratize AI and enable every organization and every person with the power of AI. What started in 2014 with the idea of providing unified access to hundreds of cognitive engines through one common software infrastructure, evolved to the world‚Äôs first AI operating system, aiWARE, which orchestrates a diverse ecosystem of cognitive engines to power intelligent automation for both commercial and government organizations. As we progress, we will continue to move... humans from ‚Äúin‚Äù to ‚Äúon‚Äù to ‚Äúout of the loop‚Äù to help them accelerate workflows, save time and costs, and uncover new insights and opportunities. You can view us at: www.veritone.com / www.veritoneone.com

Position Summary

Our team is looking to add an ambitious Vision Analytics Deep Learning Model Developer who works well in an extremely innovative and fast-paced environment. If you are capable of translating complex problems into actionable insights, then please continue reading.

What You‚Äôll Do

The successful candidate will work with a team of UK (London) based software developers to develop and evaluate a video analytic system which takes both imagery and video data and perform intelligent analysis on object detection and recognition for surveillance and business intelligence applications. The work will involve testing, evaluation and development of deep learning models and algorithms for video analysis, behavior recognition and event detection, object detection and tracking, cross-domain/cross- view object alignment and localization, re-identification and search, attribute recognition.

What You'll Need

Minimum qualifications:
‚Ä¢ Strong framework & programming skills are required including, Pytorch, Tensorflow, Python, Matlab
‚Ä¢ Experience in Exploratory data analysis.
‚Ä¢ Working with Linux Operating Systems.
‚Ä¢ Understanding of at least one relational database, such as PostgreSQL
‚Ä¢ PhD degree in computer vision is strongly preferred
‚Ä¢ Excellent communication (written / verbal).
‚Ä¢ Desire to work on the next generation of Artificial Intelligence and Vision Learning applications.
‚Ä¢ Motivated to drive tasks to completion
‚Ä¢ Ability to work in a fast-paced development environment

BONUS POINTS IF...
‚Ä¢ Relevant experience implementing state-of-the-art computer vision algorithms, comparative evaluation and testing is a strong advantage.
‚Ä¢ Programming experience in C++
‚Ä¢ Familiarity with SW Dev Tools and agile development practices

What We Offer
‚Ä¢ A competitive compensation package
‚Ä¢ Remote first + Hybrid workplace
‚Ä¢ VERI Communities (Affinity Groups) & Belonging
‚Ä¢ Empowerment to build your career journey at Veritone
‚Ä¢ Flexible (Paid) Time Off
‚Ä¢ Mental health awareness and support
‚Ä¢ An opportunity to be a part of the next big thing in artificial intelligence!

OUR CULTURE
‚Ä¢ Loves learning & continuous growth; stays current on marketing trends
‚Ä¢ Can juggle multiple projects, priorities, and deadlines with a positive attitude
‚Ä¢ Comfortable in a fast-paced, small company environment
‚Ä¢ Collaborative and always contributing value
‚Ä¢ Driven to win as a team
‚Ä¢ Remote first workplace
‚Ä¢ Check us out!

Veritone is a leading provider of artificial intelligence (AI) technology and solutions. The company's proprietary operating system, aiWARE, orchestrates an expanding ecosystem of machine learning models to transform audio, video and other data sources into actionable intelligence. We love to continuously grow while staying ahead of trends and creating structure in an unstructured world.

If you‚Äôve made it this far and align with our goals, we look forward to reviewing your qualifications!

DISCLOSURE

Our company provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics.

Should candidates not be normally resident in the UK they must be able to demonstrate their eligibility to work in the UK in accordance with the Asylum and Immigration Act 1999.

The successful candidate will be working in the Veritone UK development branch located in London
